column4: How do I set up Debian to mount iPod folders like Ubuntu. I mean Ubuntu mounts to filesystems for a jailbroken iPod, one for system folders and one for application folders.
I have installed the following packages: libmtp8 libmtp-dev libusb-dev libusb-0.1-4
But Debian only opens my photos folder
Ubuntu 11.10 fails to mount my iPod, what's wrong?
There used to be a command to fix this
apple devices are supported very badly with linux, especially since ios5.X
oh no, the Ubuntu support is greater than Windows'
yes it is, if you have a jailbroken ipod
apple devices have support in windows through itunes, no linux is supported for apple devives
I've been syncing and transferring files to my iPad and iPod on Ubuntu for years
it's not "better" supported, in linux if you think it is, great, good for you, byt you will have problems
you've been working for years...yet as I've just said it's changed since ios 5
then if I am wrong you should have no problems with your ipod and not be asking questions about why it doesn't work
